Content.Abstract: Cabin and Lodge Rentals for the Outdoor Learning Center
Content.BodyCopy:
Cabin Rentals

The BYU-Idaho Outdoor Learning Center at Badger Creek has 9 cabins available for rent during the Fall/Winter. Each cabin sleeps 6 people. Cabins have heat and electricity but do not have kitchen/bathroom facilities. Bathrooms/showers are available at the Logistics Center for use and there are several nearby latrines.

  • The cost is $35.00 per cabin.
  • A barbeque grill and propane are provided for preparing meals at the pavilion, be sure to bring your own cooking utensils and supplies.
  • The sled hill/tow rope is available for a morning or evening time slot for $45.00 with a cabin rental.
  • Check in is between 5:00 and 6:00 pm at the Logistics Center.

Cabin rentals will be on a first come, first serve basis for BYU-Idaho groups. Because we are now operating under BYU-Idaho Activities, community groups won't be able to make reservations until one month after the semester has started.

Lodge Rental

The lodge is available for rent during off seasons (inbetween semesters) and holidays.

The lodge has enough bunk beds for 24 people and includes a full sized industrial kitchen with equipment.  Men and womens' bathrooms include stall-style showers. The main floor of the lodge features a wood stove (firewood included), couches, and a foosball table.

The cost is:

  • $70.00 for a one day use
  • $160.00 for a sled hill/day use
  • $205.00 for an overnight use
  • $265.00 for an overnight/ sled hill use

Check in is between 5:00 and 6:00 pm at the Logistics Center. Check out is 11:00 am the following morning.

Check the Calendar or call Badger Creek for information on off season dates. Contact Us.
